VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Financial Overview
N/A
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
N/A
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviews were conducted during this inspection and all staff reported the
administration is very supportive and provides for their needs in an effort to provide
the care the youth require. All staff reported receiving training that helps them
increase their effectiveness with the youth. Staff report regular team meetings to
ensure the care being provided is effective.
Youth interviews were conducted during this inspection. All youth interviewed
reported staff are attentive and provide for their needs. Youth also report feeling
safe at the facility and never witnessing any staff being inappropriate with any
youth. They are provided appropriate amounts of food and hygiene items. They
also believe staff listen to them and treat them with respect.
3

Description of Agency Walk Through
This is a single-story facility with a detention unit and closed treatment unit. The
facility is well maintained and clean. It is furnished appropriately in all aspects.
Items requiring to be locked were found locked. The kitchen is clean and well
stocked with food (fresh, frozen, and dry). All plumbing was in working order.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
